intro: Echium glaucophyllum, commonly known as the blueweed or the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which includes other plants with similar medicinal and ornamental uses. Echium glaucophyllum is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and for its ecological benefits to pollinators.
